The cape of legends is a cape that can be bought for 675 coins from Siegfried Erkle on the 2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] of the Legends' Guild upon completion of the Legends' Quest. They can also purchase it from Perdu for 1,900 should they lose it after purchasing it at least once.

Like the obsidian cape, it has balanced defence bonuses, but has 2 less in each. It is therefore sometimes seen as a status symbol, as a series of challenging quests must be completed to equip it, although it is far cheaper than the obsidian cape. As a result, it is a popular choice when PKing or taking part in dangerous activities.

There are various NPCs who appear to be wearing the cape or some variation thereof.

The cape may be mounted in the Quest Hall of a player-owned house in the Guild trophy space. This requires 3 teak planks and grants 300 Construction experience. This has little purpose other than showing guests that the host has completed the Legends' Quest.

This item can be stored in the cape rack of a costume room.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • This cape was best-in-slot from its introduction in RuneScape Classic on 20 August 2003 up until the Fire cape was released on 4 October 2005.
  • Before 10 February 2005, the team capes that are now pink were coloured grey and resembled the cape of legends.
  • The Archer in search of Zanaris (the "Lost City") at the start location of the Lost City quest appears to be wearing this cape, despite Lost City being a requirement for Legends' Quest

[[File:Cape of legends detail.png|left|120px]]
The '''cape of legends''' is a cape that can be bought for {{Coins|675}} coins from [[Siegfried Erkle]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk=2}} of the [[Legends' Guild]] upon completion of the [[Legends' Quest]]. They can also purchase it from [[Perdu]] for {{Coins|1900}} should they lose it after purchasing it at least once.

Like the [[obsidian cape]], it has balanced defence bonuses, but has 2 less in each. It is therefore sometimes seen as a status symbol, as a series of challenging [[quests]] must be completed to equip it, although it is far cheaper than the obsidian cape. As a result, it is a popular choice when [[PKing]] or taking part in dangerous activities.

There are various NPCs who appear to be wearing the cape or some variation thereof.

The cape may be mounted in the [[Quest Hall]] of a [[player-owned house]] in the Guild trophy space. This requires 3 [[teak plank]]s and grants 300 [[Construction]] experience. This has little purpose other than showing guests that the host has completed the Legends' Quest.
